 .9           !- Supply Fan Motor Efficiency  1            !- Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction  SingleSspeedDX     !- Cooling Coil Type  FanAndCoilAvailSched  !- Cooling Coil Availability Schedule  14.0          !- Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature C  autosize        !- Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity W  autosize        !- Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio  3            !- Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP  Gas           !- Heating Coil Type  FanAndCoilAvailSched  !- Heating Coil Availability Schedule  50.0          !- Heating Design Supply Air Temperature C  autosize        !- Heating Coil Capacity W  .8           !- Gas Heating Coil Efficiency  0            !- Gas Heating Coil Parasitic Electric Load W  autosize        !- Maximum Outdoor air Flow Rate m3/s  autosize        !- Minimum Outdoor air Flow Rate m3/s              !- Minimum Outdoor air Schedule Name  NoEconomizer      !- Economizer Type  NoLockout        !- Economizer Lockout              !- Economizer Upper Temperature Limit C              !- Economizer Lower Temperature Limit C              !- Economizer Upper Enthalpy Limit J/kg              !- Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature C              !- Supply Plenum Name              !- Return Plenum Name  BlowThrough       !- Supply Fan Placement  CycleOnAny       !- Night Cycle Control              !- Night Cycle Control Zone Name  None          !- Heat Recovery Type              !- Sensible Heat Recovery Effectiveness              !- Latent Heat Recovery Effectiveness  None          !- Dehumidification Control Type  60           !- Dehumidification Setpoint percent  ElectricSteam

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir object?
output: This object simulates the system portion of a constant volume air handler with a direct-expansion (DX) air-to-air heat pump and supplemental heating (electric gas or hot water).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How many HVACTemplate:Zone:Unitary objects can the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir serve?
output: This system may serve one or more HVACTemplate:Zone:Unitary objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be specified if the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir serves more than one zone?
output: If this system serves more than one zone only one zone is specified as the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are common names for the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir system type?
output: Common names for this system type include packaged rooftop heat pumps commonly seen in commercial buildings and split system heat pumps commonly seen in residential buildings.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Name for the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir object?
output: Enter a name for the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir object. This name is used in the HVACTemplate:Zone:Unitary object to reference this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Field: System Availability Schedule Name is left blank?
output: Leave this field blank if you want the system to be available for the entire year to perform heating or cooling if called for by the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule specify if a name is given in the Field: System Availability Schedule Name?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the system is available should be specified as 1.0. Those times that the system is not available should have a zero value in the schedule specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir object simulate?
output: This object simulates the system portion of a constant volume air handler with a direct-expansion (DX) air-to-air heat pump and supplemental heating (electric gas or hot water).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What type of buildings commonly use packaged rooftop heat pumps and split system heat pumps?
output: Packaged rooftop heat pumps are commonly seen in commercial buildings and split system heat pumps are commonly seen in residential buildings.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Can the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir system serve more than one zone?
output: Yes this system may serve one or more HVACTemplate:Zone:Unitary objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is specified if the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir system serves more than one zone?
output: Only one zone is specified as the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Name' field for the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir object?
output: Enter a name for the HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the 'System Availability Schedule Name' field is left blank?
output: The system will be available for the entire year to perform heating or cooling if called for by the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule values be in the 'System Availability Schedule Name' field when the system is available?
output: The schedule values should be specified as 1.0 when the system is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What controls fan operation during times when the system is available?
output: The supply fan operating mode controls fan operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Control Zone or Thermostat Location Name' field?
output: Enter the name of the HVACTemplate:Zone:Unitary object that contains the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How many zones can contain a thermostat in a HVACTemplate:System:UnitaryHeatPump:AirToAir system?
output: Only one of the zones can contain a thermostat that controls heating and cooling operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: No this flow rate will not be multiplied by a sizing factor or by zone multipliers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be ensured if using zone multipliers for the Heating Supply Air Flow Rate?
output: A value entered here must be large enough to serve the multiplied zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the Heating Supply Air Flow Rate?
output: The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Heating Supply Air Flow Rate?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate field specify?
output: This field specifies the supply air flow rate when neither cooling nor heating is required (i.e. DX coil and heater are off but the supply air fan operates).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate field used?
output: This field is only used when the supply air fan operating mode schedule specifies continuous fan operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the values be for the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate?
output: Values must be greater than or equal to zero or this field is autosizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the supply air fan operating mode schedule specifies continuous fan operation and the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate is set to zero or left blank?
output: The model assumes that the supply air flow rate when no cooling/heating is needed is equal to the supply air flow rate when the cooling or heating coil was last operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if 'Autosize' is entered for the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate?
output: The supply air flow rate will be sized to match the smaller of the Cooling and Heating flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Will a value entered in the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate field be multiplied by the sizing factor or by zone multipliers?
output: No a value entered in this field will not be multiplied by the sizing factor or by zone multipliers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is recommended when using zone multipliers for the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate?
output: It is best to autosize or leave blank when using zone multipliers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate?
output: The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Supply Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name field specify?
output: This field specifies the name of the supply air fan operating mode schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How may the supply air fan operating mode vary during the simulation?
output: The supply air fan operating mode may vary based on time-of-day or with a change of season.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do schedule values of 0 indicate for the supply air fan operating mode?
output: Schedule values of 0 denote that the supply air fan and the heating or cooling coil cycle on and off together to meet the heating or cooling load (a.k.a. AUTO fan).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do schedule values other than 0 indicate for the supply air fan operating mode?
output: Schedule values other than 0 denote that the supply fan runs continuously while the heating or cooling coil cycles to meet the load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Supply Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name field is left blank?
output: A schedule of always zero (cycling fan) will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Supply Fan Placement field?
output: Enter the supply fan placement type.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the Supply Fan Placement field?
output: This alpha field has two choices DrawThrough or BlowThrough.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does DrawThrough model in the context of supply fan placement?
output: DrawThrough models a system where the supply air fan is after the dx cooling/heating coil and before the supplemental heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the supply air fan required to operate?
output: The supply air fan is required to operate when the DX coil and heater are off but the supply air fan operates continuously.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the values for the supply air fan operation be?
output: Values must be greater than or equal to zero or this field is autosizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the supply air flow rate is set to zero or left blank?
output: The model assumes that the supply air flow rate when no cooling/heating is needed is equal to the supply air flow rate when the cooling or heating coil was last operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does entering 'Autosize' do for the supply air flow rate?
output: Entering 'Autosize' sizes the supply air flow rate to match the smaller of the Cooling and Heating flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the unit for the supply air flow rate?
output: The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for the supply air flow rate?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name' field specify?
output: This field specifies the name of the supply air fan operating mode schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do schedule values of 0 indicate for the supply air fan?
output: Schedule values of 0 denote that the supply air fan and the heating or cooling coil cycle on and off together to meet the heating or cooling load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default schedule if the 'Supply Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name' field is left blank?
output: A schedule of always zero (cycling fan) will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the 'Supply Fan Placement' field?
output: The choices are 'DrawThrough' or 'BlowThrough'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'DrawThrough' model in supply fan placement?
output: 'DrawThrough' models a system where the supply air fan is after the dx cooling/heating coil and before the supplemental heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default supply fan placement?
output: The default is 'BlowThrough'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the definition of 'Supply Fan Total Efficiency'?
output: It is the overall efficiency of the fan i.e. the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for 'Supply Fan Total Efficiency'?
output: The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default pressure rise for 'Supply Fan Delta Pressure'?
output: The default is 600 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for 'Supply Fan Motor Efficiency'?
output: The default is 0.9.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 mean for 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction'?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default fraction for 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction'?
output: The default is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the only current choice for 'Cooling Coil Type'?
output: The only current choice is 'SingleSpeedDX'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default configuration for the air fan in relation to the coils?
output: The default configuration for the air fan is before the dx cooling/heating coil and the supplemental heating coil with the default being BlowThrough.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Supply Fan Total Efficiency' field?
output: The 'Supply Fan Total Efficiency' field is for entering the total efficiency of the supply fan which is the overall efficiency of the fan i.e. the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the motor efficiency defined?
output: The motor efficiency is defined as the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the impeller efficiency defined?
output: The impeller efficiency is defined as the power delivered to the fluid (air) divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is calculated by multiplying the mass flow rate of the air by the pressure rise and dividing by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range for the 'Supply Fan Total Efficiency' input value?
output: The input value for 'Supply Fan Total Efficiency' must be between 0 and 1 with a default of 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Fan Delta Pressure' field specify?
output: The 'Supply Fan Delta Pressure' field specifies the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions with a default of 600 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are considered standard conditions in the context of 'Supply Fan Delta Pressure'?
output: Standard conditions are considered 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for 'Supply Fan Motor Efficiency'?
output: The default value for 'Supply Fan Motor Efficiency' is 0.9.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field represent?
output: The 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field represents the fraction of the motor heat that is added to the air stream with a value between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 in the 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field indicate?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1 in the 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field indicate?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for the 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field?
output: The default for the 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'Cooling Coil Type' field used for?
output: The 'Cooling Coil Type' field is used to enter the type of cooling coil with the current choice being SingleSpeedDX.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What might future versions of the 'Cooling Coil Type' field include?
output: Future versions may have additional cooling coil types.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the 'Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name'?
output: The default setting for the 'Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name' is usually blank allowing the cooling coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does specifying a schedule name affect the 'Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name'?
output: Specifying a schedule name defines when the coil is available often used when cooling is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 1.0 indicate in the 'Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name'?
output: A schedule value of 1.0 indicates that the cooling coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of zero indicate in the 'Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name'?
output: A schedule value of zero denotes that the cooling coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature' field used for?
output: The 'Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature' field is used to enter the cooling supply air temperature in °C for sizing the cooling coil and zone supply air flow rates with a default of 12.8°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature'?
output: The default value for the 'Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature' is 12.8°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does entering 'Autosize' in the 'Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity' field do?
output: Entering 'Autosize' lets the automatic sizing algorithm determine the cooling coil capacity based on the maximum cooling loads during the cooling design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity' field represent if a value is entered?
output: If a value is entered it represents the full load gross total cooling capacity including both sensible and latent capacity in watts of the DX coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the 'Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity'?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7°C drybulb/19.4°C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35°C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the 'Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity'?
output: The default setting for the 'Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity' is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does entering 'Autosize' in the 'Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio' field do?
output: Entering 'Autosize' allows the sizing algorithm to determine the sensible heat ratio based on the rated capacity and air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio' field if not using 'Autosize'?
output: If not using 'Autosize' enter the value of the ratio of the gross sensible capacity divided by the gross total cooling capacity of the DX cooling coil at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the 'Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio'?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7°C drybulb/19.4°C wetbulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is usually set to blank for the cooling coil availability schedule name?
output: Usually set to blank which allows the cooling coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a schedule name is specified for the cooling coil?
output: If a schedule name is specified it defines when the coil is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the cooling coil availability schedule most often used?
output: This is most often used when cooling is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 1.0 indicate for the cooling coil?
output: A schedule value of 1.0 indicates that the cooling coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of zero denote for the cooling coil?
output: A value of zero denotes that the cooling coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the cooling design supply air temperature?
output: Enter the cooling supply air temperature in °C to be used for sizing the cooling coil and zone supply air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling design supply air temperature?
output: The default is 12.8°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the cooling coil gross rated total capacity?
output: Enter Autosize to let the automatic sizing algorithm determine the cooling coil capacity based on the maximum cooling loads during the cooling design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a specified value represent for the cooling coil gross rated total capacity?
output: If a value is entered it represents the full load gross total cooling capacity including both sensible and latent capacity in watts of the DX coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the cooling coil gross rated total capacity?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7°C drybulb/19.4°C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35°C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be the capacity of the cooling coil gross rated total capacity?
output: Capacity should be the 'gross' capacity where the effect of supply air fan heat is not accounted for.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the cooling coil gross rated total capacity?
output: The units are in W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for the cooling coil gross rated total capacity?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the cooling coil gross rated sensible heat ratio?
output: Enter Autosize to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the sensible heat ratio based on the rated capacity and air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered if not using Autosize for the cooling coil gross rated sensible heat ratio?
output: Otherwise enter the value of the ratio of the gross sensible capacity divided by the gross total cooling capacity of the DX cooling coil at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the cooling coil gross rated sensible heat ratio?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7°C drybulb/19.4°C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35°C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What capacities should be used to define the Rated Sensible Heat Ratio (SHR)?
output: Both the sensible and total cooling capacities used to define the Rated Sensible Heat Ratio (SHR) should be 'gross' capacity where the effect of supply air fan heat is not accounted for.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for the cooling coil gross rated sensible heat ratio?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the cooling coil gross rated COP?
output: Enter the coefficient of performance defined as the gross cooling coil capacity in watts divided by electrical power input in watts of the DX cooling coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the cooling coil gross rated COP?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7°C drybulb/19.4°C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35°C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the input power include for the cooling coil gross rated COP?
output: The input power includes electric power for the compressor and condenser fan but does not include the power consumption of the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the gross COP not account for?
output: The gross COP should not account for the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for the cooling coil gross rated COP?
output: The default is 3.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the heat pump heating coil type?
output: Enter the type of heat pump heating coil. There is currently only one choice for this field SingleSpeedDXHeatPump.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the heating design supply air temperature?
output: Enter the heating supply air temperature in °C to be used for sizing the heating coil and zone supply air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default heating design supply air temperature?
output: The default is 50°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is usually set to blank for the heat pump heating coil availability schedule name?
output: Usually set to blank which allows the heat pump heating coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a schedule name is specified for the heat pump heating coil?
output: If a schedule name is specified it defines when the coil is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the heat pump heating coil availability schedule most often used?
output: This is most often used when heating is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 1.0 indicate for the heat pump heating coil?
output: A schedule value of 1.0 indicates that the heat pump heating coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of zero denote for the heat pump heating coil?
output: A value of zero denotes that the heat pump heating coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: At what temperature does air enter the outdoor condenser coil?
output: Air enters the outdoor condenser coil at 35°C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be used to define the Rated Sensible Heat Ratio (SHR)?
output: Both the sensible and total cooling capacities should be 'gross' capacity where the effect of supply air fan heat is not accounted for.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the Rated Sensible Heat Ratio (SHR)?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP defined?
output: It is defined as the gross cooling coil capacity in watts divided by electrical power input in watts of the DX cooling coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7°C drybulb/19.4°C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35°C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the input power for the Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP include?
output: The input power includes electric power for the compressor and condenser fan but does not include the power consumption of the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP?
output: The default is 3.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What type of heat pump heating coil is currently available?
output: The only choice is SingleSpeedDXHeatPump.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default Heating Design Supply Air Temperature?
output: The default is 50°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a blank Heat Pump Heating Coil Availability Schedule Name indicate?
output: It indicates that the heat pump heating coil is available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: It indicates that the heat pump heating coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When will the compressor not operate for DX heating or cooling?
output: The compressor will not operate (for DX heating or DX cooling) when outdoor dry-bulb temperatures fall below this value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the temperature range for the heat pump defrost maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the heat pump defrost maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature if left blank?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the two choices for the heat pump defrost strategy?
output: This alpha field has two choices: ReverseCycle or Resistive.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the ReverseCycle defrost strategy is selected?
output: If the ReverseCycle strategy is selected the heating cycle is reversed periodically to provide heat to melt frost accumulated on the outdoor coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the Resistive defrost strategy is selected?
output: If a Resistive defrost strategy is selected the frost is melted using an electric resistance heater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default defrost strategy if the field is left blank?
output: If this input field is left blank the default defrost strategy is ReverseCycle.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the two choices for the heat pump defrost control?
output: This alpha field has two choices: Timed or OnDemand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when Timed defrost control is selected?
output: If Timed control is selected the defrost time period is calculated based on a fixed value or compressor runtime whether or not frost has actually accumulated.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the defrost time period calculated for OnDemand defrost control?
output: For OnDemand defrost control the defrost time period is calculated based on outdoor weather (humidity ratio) conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What condition prevents defrost from occurring regardless of the defrost control selected?
output: Defrost does not occur above the user specified outdoor temperature entered in the input field Heat Pump Defrost Maximum Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature described above.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: If this input field is left blank the default defrost control is Timed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a schedule name is specified for the minimum outdoor air flow rate?
output: If a schedule name is specified values are decimal fractions (0.0 -- 1.0) that multiply the minimum outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the schedule for the minimum outdoor air flow rate useful?
output: This schedule is useful for reducing the outdoor air flow rate during unoccupied or start up hours.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the economizer type field?
output: The options for this field are FixedDryBulb DifferentialDryBulb FixedEnthalpy DifferentialEnthalpy ElectronicEnthalpy FixedDewPointAndDryBulb DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'NoEconomizer' mean?
output: Choosing NoEconomizer means the economizer will not operate and the outdoor airflow rate will be at the minimum for the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'FixedDryBulb' mean?
output: Choosing FixedDryBulb means the economizer will set the outdoor airflow rate at minimum if the outdoor air temperature is higher than a specified dry-bulb temperature limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'DifferentialDryBulb' do?
output: Choosing DifferentialDryBulb will trigger the outdoor airflow to minimum when the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air is higher than the dry-bulb temperature of the return air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'FixedEnthalpy' check?
output: FixedEnthalpy checks the upper limit of the enthalpy given as a field input against the enthalpy content of outdoor air and will set the outdoor airflow rate to minimum if the latter is greater than the former.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'DifferentialEnthalpy' do?
output: DifferentialEnthalpy compares the return air enthalpy with the enthalpy of outdoor air. When the enthalpy of outdoor air is greater than the enthalpy of the return air the outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'ElectronicEnthalpy' enable?
output: Choosing ElectronicEnthalpy enables the simulation to calculate the humidity ratio limit of outdoor air based on the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air and a quadratic/cubic curve and compare it to the actual outdoor air humidity ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated humidity ratio limit in 'ElectronicEnthalpy'?
output: If the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated humidity ratio limit then the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of specifying a schedule name in relation to the minimum outdoor air flow rate?
output: If a schedule name is specified values are decimal fractions (0.0 -- 1.0) that multiply the minimum outdoor air flow rate. This schedule is useful for reducing the outdoor air flow rate during unoccupied or start up hours.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options available for the economizer type field?
output: The options for this field are FixedDryBulb DifferentialDryBulb FixedEnthalpy DifferentialEnthalpy ElectronicEnthalpy (i.e. humidity ratio curve strategy) FixedDewPointAndDryBulb DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy and NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if 'NoEconomizer' is chosen for the economizer type?
output: Choosing NoEconomizer means the economizer will not operate and the outdoor airflow rate will be at the minimum for the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'FixedDryBulb' mean for economizer operation?
output: Choosing FixedDryBulb means the economizer will set the outdoor airflow rate at minimum if the outdoor air temperature is higher than a specified dry-bulb temperature limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'DifferentialDryBulb' trigger in terms of outdoor airflow?
output: Choosing DifferentialDryBulb will trigger the outdoor airflow to minimum when the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air is higher than the dry-bulb temperature of the return air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does 'FixedEnthalpy' affect the outdoor airflow rate?
output: FixedEnthalpy checks the upper limit of the enthalpy given as a field input against the enthalpy content of outdoor air and will set the outdoor airflow rate to minimum if the latter is greater than the former.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of 'DifferentialEnthalpy' in economizer operation?
output: DifferentialEnthalpy compares the return air enthalpy with the enthalpy of outdoor air. When the enthalpy of outdoor air is greater than the enthalpy of the return air the outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'ElectronicEnthalpy' enable in the simulation?
output: Choosing ElectronicEnthalpy enables the simulation to calculate the humidity ratio limit of outdoor air based on the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air and a quadratic/cubic curve and compare it to the actual outdoor air humidity ratio. If the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated humidity ratio limit then the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' control the outdoor airflow rate?
output: Choosing FixedDewPointAndDryBulb compares both the outdoor dewpoint temperature and the outdoor dry-bulb temperature to their specified high limit values. If either outdoor temperature exceeds the high limit value the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of 'DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy' in economizer control?
output: Another option DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy enables the control strategy to be based on both the DifferentialDryBulb and DifferentialEnthalpy economizer control strategies.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What additional checks are performed by each economizer control type?
output: In addition to all economizer control types listed above each control type checks for user-entered values for the upper limit of dry-bulb temperature enthalpy limit humidity ratio limit and dewpoint limit. The outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum if any of these entered limits are exceeded.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the economizer type field?
output: The default for this field is NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices available for the economizer lockout field?
output: Enter one of the following choices for this field: NoLockout LockoutWithHeating LockoutWithCompressor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the economizer lockout field?
output: The default value is NoLockout.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'LockoutWithHeating' option mean for economizer operation?
output: The LockoutWithHeating means that if the packaged unit is in heating mode the economizer is locked out -- i.e. the economizer dampers are closed and there is minimum outdoor air flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'LockoutWithCompressor' option entail for economizer operation?
output: LockoutWithCompressor means that in addition to locking out the economizer when the unit is in heating mode the economizer is locked out when the DX unit compressor is on. In other words when the DX coil is off the economizer must meet the entire cooling load -- it isn’t allowed to operate in conjunction with the DX cooling coil. Similarly when the DX coil is operating the economizer is not allowed to operate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is another name for the 'LockoutWithCompressor' option?
output: The LockoutWithCompressor option is sometimes called a \nonintegrated economizer.\

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the input for the economizer maximum limit dry-bulb temperature field?
output: Input for this field is the outdoor air temperature high limit (ºC) for economizer operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air temperature exceeds the economizer maximum limit dry-bulb temperature?
output: If the outdoor air temperature is above this limit the outdoor airflow rate will be set.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if either outdoor temperature exceeds the high limit value?
output: If either outdoor temperature exceeds the high limit value the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy option enable?
output: The DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy option enables the control strategy to be based on both the DifferentialDryBulb and DifferentialEnthalpy economizer control strategies.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do all economizer control types check for?
output: All economizer control types check for user-entered values for the upper limit of dry-bulb temperature enthalpy limit humidity ratio limit and dewpoint limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if any of the entered limits are exceeded?
output: The outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum if any of these entered limits are exceeded.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for the economizer field?
output: The default for this field is NoEconomizer.

output: LockoutWithCompressor means that in addition to locking out the economizer when the unit is in heating mode the economizer is also locked out when the DX unit compressor is on.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the DX coil is off in LockoutWithCompressor mode?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What input is required for the Economizer Maximum Limit Dry-Bulb Temperature field?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air temperature is above the Economizer Maximum Limit Dry-Bulb Temperature?
output: If the outdoor air temperature is above this limit the outdoor airflow rate will be set to the minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Economizer Maximum Limit Dry-Bulb Temperature field required?
output: This field is required if Economizer Control Type 'FixedDryBulb' or 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' has been specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What input is required for the Economizer Maximum Limit Enthalpy field?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air enthalpy is above the Economizer Maximum Limit Enthalpy?
