output: The default value is 'NoLockout'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'LockoutWithHeating' mean?
output: 'LockoutWithHeating' means that if the packaged unit is in heating mode the economizer is locked out -- i.e. the economizer dampers are closed and there is minimum outdoor air flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'LockoutWithCompressor' mean?
output: 'LockoutWithCompressor' means that in addition to locking out the economizer when the unit is in heating mode the economizer is locked out when the DX unit compressor is on. In other words when the DX coil is off the economizer must meet the entire cooling load -- it isn't allowed to operate in conjunction with the DX cooling coil. Similarly when the DX coil is operating the economizer is not allowed to operate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is another name for the 'LockoutWithCompressor' option?
output: The 'LockoutWithCompressor' option is sometimes called a 'nonintegrated economizer'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the input for 'Economizer Maximum Limit Dry-Bulb Temperature'?
output: Input for this field is the outdoor air temperature high limit (ºC) for economizer operation. If the outdoor air temperature is above this limit the outdoor airflow rate will be set to the minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the 'Economizer Maximum Limit Dry-Bulb Temperature' field required?
output: This field is required if Economizer Control Type 'FixedDryBulb' or 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' has been specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a blank input in the 'Economizer Maximum Limit Dry-Bulb Temperature' field mean?
output: No input (blank) in this field means that there is no outdoor air temperature high limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the input for 'Economizer Maximum Limit Enthalpy'?
output: Enter the outdoor air upper enthalpy limit (in J/kg) for economizer operation. If the outdoor air enthalpy is above this value the outdoor air flow rate will be set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the user-entered limits for dry-bulb temperature enthalpy limit humidity ratio limit and dewpoint limit are exceeded?
output: The outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum if any of these entered limits are exceeded.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the economizer control option?
output: The default for this field is NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the field 'Economizer Lockout'?
output: The choices for this field are: NoLockout LockoutWithHeating LockoutWithCompressor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The default value is NoLockout.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'LockoutWithHeating' mean for the economizer?
output: LockoutWithHeating means that if the packaged unit is in heating mode the economizer is locked out the economizer dampers are closed and there is minimum outdoor air flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'LockoutWithCompressor' mean for the economizer?
output: LockoutWithCompressor means that in addition to locking out the economizer when the unit is in heating mode the economizer is also locked out when the DX unit compressor is on.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the implication of the 'LockoutWithCompressor' option?
output: When the DX coil is off the economizer must meet the entire cooling load and is not allowed to operate in conjunction with the DX cooling coil. Similarly when the DX coil is operating the economizer is not allowed to operate. This option is sometimes called a 'nonintegrated economizer'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Heat Recovery Heat Exchanger Type' field denote?
output: This alpha field denotes the type of heat exchanger being modeled: Plate (e.g. fixed plate) or Rotary (e.g. rotating cylinder or wheel).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the heat exchanger type affect the modeling?
output: The heat exchanger type affects the modeling of frost control options and supply air outlet temperature control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is frost formation or supply air outlet temperature controlled for rotary heat exchangers?
output: For rotary heat exchangers rotational speed is varied to control frost formation or the supply air outlet temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the desired effect obtained for plate exchangers?
output: For plate exchangers air bypass around the heat exchanger is used to obtain the desired effect.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the 'Heat Recovery Frost Control Type' field?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default frost control type if the field is left blank?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should preheat frost control be modeled?
output: For modeling preheat frost control specify 'None' for this input field and insert a separate heating coil object in the supply inlet air stream to keep the air temperature above the desired frost threshold temperature.

output: This alpha field has four choices: None ExhaustAirRecirculation ExhaustOnly and MinimumExhaustTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default frost control type if the 'Field: Heat Recovery Frost Control Type' is left blank?
output: The default frost control type is 'None'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should preheat frost control be modeled?
output: For modeling preheat frost control specify 'None' for this input field and insert a separate heating coil object in the supply inlet air stream to keep the air temperature above the desired frost threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens in 'ExhaustAirRecirculation' frost control?
output: Dampers are used to direct exhaust air back into the zone through the supply side of the heat exchanger when the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature falls below a threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What determines the fraction of time that exhaust air is circulated in 'ExhaustAirRecirculation'?
output: The fraction of time that exhaust air is circulated through the supply side of the heat exchanger is dependent on the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature with respect to the threshold temperature the initial defrost time fraction and the rate of change of defrost time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when exhaust air is being recirculated in 'ExhaustAirRecirculation'?
output: When exhaust air is being recirculated no supply (outdoor ventilation) air is being provided through the heat exchanger unit (which may or may not be acceptable regarding ventilation for occupants).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'ExhaustOnly (supply air bypass)' control do?
output: This control cycles off the supply air flow through the heat exchanger for a certain period of time while the exhaust air continues to flow through the exhaust side of the heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What determines the fraction of time that the supply flow is cycled off in 'ExhaustOnly'?
output: The fraction of time that the supply flow through the heat exchanger is cycled off is dependent on the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature with respect to the threshold temperature the initial defrost time fraction and the rate of change of defrost time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What provisions are made to avoid building depressurization in 'ExhaustOnly' frost control?
output: Provisions are usually made to avoid building depressurization when this frost control is operating (automatic or pressure-operated dampers or a bypass air damper around the supply side of the heat exchanger).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What assumption is made about supply air in 'ExhaustOnly' frost control?
output: For this frost control type it is assumed that the supply air is bypassed around the heat exchanger during frost control operation (i.e. the total supply flow is not reduced during defrost but merely bypassed around the heat exchanger).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'MinimumExhaustTemperature' control do?
output: The temperature of the exhaust air leaving the heat exchanger is monitored and the heat exchanger effectiveness is decreased (by slowing heat exchanger rotation or bypassing supply air around the plate exchanger) to keep the exhaust air from falling below the threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of the ExhaustAirRecirculation dampers?
output: ExhaustAirRecirculation dampers are used to direct exhaust air back into the zone through the supply side of the heat exchanger when the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature falls below a threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: On what factors does the fraction of time that exhaust air is circulated through the supply side of the heat exchanger depend?
output: The fraction of time that exhaust air is circulated through the supply side of the heat exchanger is dependent on the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature with respect to the threshold temperature the initial defrost time fraction and the rate of change of defrost time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when exhaust air is being recirculated?
output: When exhaust air is being recirculated no supply (outdoor ventilation) air is being provided through the heat exchanger unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the ExhaustOnly (supply air bypass) control?
output: The ExhaustOnly control cycles off the supply air flow through the heat exchanger for a certain period while the exhaust air continues to flow through the exhaust side of the heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the factors influencing the fraction of time that the supply flow through the heat exchanger is cycled off in the ExhaustOnly control?
output: The fraction of time that the supply flow through the heat exchanger is cycled off is dependent on the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature with respect to the threshold temperature the initial defrost time fraction and the rate of change of defrost time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What provisions are usually made when implementing the ExhaustOnly control in real applications?
output: Provisions are usually made to avoid building depressurization when the ExhaustOnly control is operating such as automatic or pressure-operated dampers or a bypass air damper around the supply side of the heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What assumption is made about the supply air in the ExhaustOnly control type?
output: It is assumed that the supply air is bypassed around the heat exchanger during frost control operation meaning the total supply flow is not reduced during defrost but merely bypassed around the heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is monitored in the MinimumExhaustTemperature control?
output: The temperature of the exhaust air leaving the heat exchanger is monitored in the MinimumExhaustTemperature control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the heat exchanger effectiveness adjusted in the MinimumExhaustTemperature control?
output: The heat exchanger effectiveness is decreased by slowing heat exchanger rotation or bypassing supply air around the plate exchanger to keep the exhaust air from falling below the threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the three dehumidification control type options available?
output: The three dehumidification control type options available are None CoolReheat and Multimode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the CoolReheat option do?
output: The CoolReheat option cools beyond the dry-bulb setpoint as required to meet the humidity setpoint if the system is capable of doing so with reheat provided as required by the reheat coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How are heating coils modeled in the simulation when using the CoolReheat option?
output: In the simulation two instances of the heating coil are modeled even if the main heating coil acts as the reheat coil in the actual system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: For which cooling coil type is the Multimode dehumidification control applicable?
output: The Multimode dehumidification control is only applicable for cooling coil type TwoStageHumidityControlDX.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Multimode dehumidification control do?
output: In the Multimode dehumidification control the enhanced dehumidification mode is activated as needed but the system operates to meet the sensible dry-bulb temperature cooling setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default dehumidification control type?
output: The default dehumidification control type is None which meets the sensible cooling load only.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the humidistat located?
output: The humidistat is located in the same zone specified as the Control Zone or Thermostat Location Name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint specify?
output: This field specifies the zone humidistat setpoint for dehumidification in percent (0 to 100).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint?
output: The default value for the Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint is 60%.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint ignored?
output: The Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint is ignored if a Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name is specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name require?
output: This field requires the name of the dehumidification setpoint schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the setpoint will be constant at the Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: In what units are the values in the Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule?
output: The values in the schedule are in percent (0 to 100).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Can the humidifier rated electric power be autosized?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the autosized humidifier rated electric power calculated?
output: When it is autosized it is calculated from the rated capacity in kg/s and the enthalpy rise in J/kg of the feed water from a reference temperature of liquid water at 20°C to saturated steam at 100°C.

input: What does the 'Sizing Option' field specify?
output: This field specifies the sizing method for the system supply air flow rate.

input: What does 'Coincident' sizing refer to?
output: 'Coincident' sizes on the sum of the coincident zone supply air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'NonCoincident' sizing refer to?
output: 'NonCoincident' sizes on sum of the noncoincident zone design supply air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered if the system has a return fan?
output: Enter 'Yes' if the system has a return fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the presence of a return fan?
output: The default is 'No'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the total efficiency of the return fan defined?
output: The total efficiency of the return fan is the ratio of the power delivered to the air to the electrical input power at maximum flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the components of the return fan's total efficiency?
output: The total efficiency is also the product of the fan motor efficiency and fan (impeller) efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is motor efficiency defined?
output: The motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is fan efficiency defined?
output: The fan efficiency is the power delivered to the air divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the required range for the total efficiency of the return fan?
output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default total efficiency for the return fan?
output: Default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the return fan delta pressure?
output: Enter the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are considered standard conditions for the return fan delta pressure?
output: Standard conditions are considered 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default pressure rise for the return fan delta pressure?
output: The default is 300 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the return fan motor efficiency defined?
output: Enter the shaft power of the return fan divided by the electrical power consumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the required range for the return fan motor efficiency?
output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default motor efficiency for the return fan?
output: Default is 0.9.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the return fan motor in air stream fraction?
output: Enter the fraction of the motor heat that is added to the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 indicate for the return fan motor in air stream fraction?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1 indicate for the return fan motor in air stream fraction?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the required range for the return fan motor in air stream fraction?
output: Must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the return fan motor in air stream fraction?
output: Default is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should you do if you want the system to be available for the entire year?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified in the schedule if a schedule name is used for system availability?
output: Times when the system is available should be specified as 1.0 and times when it is not available should have a zero value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the system availability schedule represent for this system type?
output: It is a schedule of when the system is providing air flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate?
output: Enter 'Autosize' to set the system maximum air-flow rate to the sum of the zone air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a value is entered for the maximum air-flow rate?
output: It becomes the upper limit on system flow even if the zone level air flow inputs sum to a greater value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Will the flow rate be multiplied by a sizing factor or zone multipliers?
output: No the flow rate will not be multiplied by a sizing factor or by zone multipliers.

input: What must be considered if using zone multipliers?
output: A value entered must be large enough to serve the multiplied zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the supply fan total efficiency represent?
output: It represents the overall efficiency of the fan i.e. the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the supply fan total efficiency calculated?
output: It is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of entering a name for the HVACTemplate:System:VAV object?
output: This name is used in the HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV object to reference this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if you leave the System Availability Schedule Name field blank?
output: The system will be available for the entire year to perform heating or cooling if called for by the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified in a schedule for system availability?
output: Times when the system is available should be specified as 1.0 and times when it is not available should have a zero value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the significance of the schedule for the system type?
output: It is a schedule of when the system is providing air flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does entering 'Autosize' in the Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate field do?
output: It sets the system maximum air-flow rate to the sum of the zone air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a value is entered for the maximum air-flow rate?
output: It is the upper limit on system flow even if the zone level air flow inputs sum to a greater value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Will the flow rate be multiplied by a sizing factor or by zone multipliers?
output: No the flow rate will not be multiplied by a sizing factor or by zone multipliers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be considered if using zone multipliers?
output: A value entered must be large enough to serve the multiplied zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate?
output: The units are m³/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Supply Fan Minimum Flow Rate field?
output: Enter the minimum supply air volume that may be provided which may be set to autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the Supply Fan Minimum Flow Rate?
output: The units are in m³/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Supply Fan Total Efficiency field?
output: Enter the total efficiency of the supply fan which is the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Supply Fan Total Efficiency?
output: The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the Supply Fan Total Efficiency input value be between?
output: The input value must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Supply Fan Delta Pressure field?
output: Enter the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are considered standard conditions for the Supply Fan Delta Pressure?
output: Standard conditions are 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Supply Fan Delta Pressure?
output: The default is 1000 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Supply Fan Motor efficiency field?
output: Enter the shaft power of the supply fan divided by the electrical power consumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the Supply Fan Motor efficiency value be?
output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction field?
output: Enter the fraction of the motor heat that is added to the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 mean in the Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1 mean in the Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction value be between?
output: Must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the two available Cooling Coil Types?
output: The two coil types available are ChilledWater and ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which coil model is preferred for most applications?
output: ChilledWater uses the COIL:Cooling:Water object with the DetailedAnalysis option and is the preferred coil model for most applications.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which object does ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel use?
output: ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel uses the Coil:Cooling:Water:DetailedGeometry object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default Cooling Coil Type?
output: The default is ChilledWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is usually set for the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name?
output: It is usually set to blank which allows the cooling coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does specifying a schedule name for the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name field do?
output: It defines when the coil is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the formula for impeller efficiency?
output: The impeller efficiency is power delivered to the fluid (air) divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range for the input value?
output: This input value must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the input?
output: The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Supply Fan Delta Pressure field?
output: Enter the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are standard conditions for the Supply Fan Delta Pressure?
output: Standard conditions are considered 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default pressure rise value for the Supply Fan Delta Pressure?
output: The default is 1000 Pa.

input: What should be entered for the Supply Fan Motor efficiency field?
output: Enter the shaft power of the supply fan divided by the electrical power consumed.

input: What is the valid range for the Supply Fan Motor efficiency?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction field represent?
output: Enter the fraction of the motor heat that is added to the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 mean for the Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

input: What does a value of 1 mean for the Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

output: Must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the available cooling coil types?
output: There are two coil types available: ChilledWater and ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What object does the ChilledWater coil type use?
output: ChilledWater uses the COIL:Cooling:Water object with the DetailedAnalysis option.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which coil model is preferred for most applications?
output: The ChilledWater coil model is preferred for most applications.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What object does the ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel coil type use?
output: ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel uses the Coil:Cooling:Water:DetailedGeometry object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil type?
output: The default is ChilledWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is usually set for the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name field?
output: Usually set to blank which allows the cooling coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule name specify in the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name field?
output: If a schedule name is specified it defines when the coil is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name most often used?
output: This is most often used when cooling is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of one indicate in the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name?
output: A schedule value of one indicates that the cooling coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of zero denote in the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name?
output: A value of zero denotes that the cooling coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if a constant setpoint for the cooling coil is to be specified?
output: Leave this field blank and the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint value will be used at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if a set point schedule is to be used for the cooling coil?
output: Specify the schedule name here.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule control in the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name?
output: The schedule should control the supply air temperature delivered to the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the leaving air temperature for Blow Through fan placement?
output: For Blow Through fan placement this is the leaving air temperature from the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the leaving air temperature for Draw Through fan placement?
output: For Draw Through fan placement this is the leaving air temperature after the supply fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: In what units are the values in the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule?
output: The values in the schedule are in degrees C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field ignored?
output: This field is ignored if the Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type is something other than None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint field?
output: Enter the cooling supply air temperature in C to be used for sizing the cooling coil and zone supply air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint?
output: The default is 12.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint value used as a constant cooling supply air setpoint temperature?
output: If no Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule or Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type is specified this value is used as a constant cooling supply air setpoint temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the heating coil located?
output: The heating coil is located in the supply air stream upstream of the cooling coil and after the outdoor air mixing box.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if no central heating coil is used in the VAV system?
output: The option 'none' should be specified here.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Is it likely that both a heating coil and a preheat coil would be used at the same time?
output: It is unlikely that both a heating coil and a preheat coil would be used at the same time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the heating coil type field?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the heating coil type?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the configuration of HVACTemplate:System:VAV assume?
output: It assumes that there will be reheat coils or baseboard heating to provide heating control at the zone level.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be coordinated if a heating coil is specified?
output: The heating and cooling coil setpoint controls and availability schedules must coordinate to prevent the coils from opposing each other.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does leaving the Heating Coil Availability Schedule Name field blank imply?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of one indicate for the heating coil?
output: A schedule value of one indicates that the heating coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if a constant setpoint for the heating coil is desired?
output: If a constant setpoint for the heating coil is desired leave the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field blank and the Heating Coil Design Setpoint value will be used at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default heating supply air temperature for sizing the heating coil?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should gas burner efficiency be entered?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default gas burner efficiency?
output: The default gas burner efficiency is 0.8.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the Gas Heating Coil Parasitic Electric Load?
output: The units for the Gas Heating Coil Parasitic Electric Load are in watts (W).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the preheat coil located?
output: The preheat coil is located in the outdoor air stream upstream of the outdoor air mixing box.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the Preheat Coil Type field?
output: The choices for the Preheat Coil Type field are HotWater Electric Gas and None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be coordinated if a preheat coil is specified?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 1.0 indicate for the preheat coil?

output: The entered value is used to define the Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate for the Controller:OutdoorAir object that will be generated by this template.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the minimum outdoor air control type?
output: Choices for this field are FixedMinimum or ProportionalMinimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does FixedMinimum mean for the minimum outdoor air flow rate?
output: FixedMinimum means that the minimum outdoor air flow rate is fixed no matter what the actual system flow rate is.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does ProportionalMinimum mean for the minimum outdoor air flow rate?
output: ProportionalMinimum means the minimum outdoor air flow rate varies in proportion to the total system air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the minimum outdoor air control type?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should you do if you want the minimum outdoor air to be the same for all hours in the entire year?
output: Leave this field blank if you want the minimum outdoor air to be the same for all hours in the entire year.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of specifying a schedule name for the minimum outdoor air?
output: If a schedule name is specified values are decimal fractions (0.0 -- 1.0) that multiply the minimum outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the use of the schedule for the minimum outdoor air?
output: This schedule is useful for reducing the outdoor air flow rate to zero during unoccupied or start up hours.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the economizer type?
output: The options for this field are FixedDryBulb DifferentialDryBulb FixedEnthalpy DifferentialEnthalpy ElectronicEnthalpy FixedDewPointAndDryBulb DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy and NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing NoEconomizer mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing NoEconomizer means the economizer will not operate and the outdoor airflow rate will be at the minimum for the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing FixedDryBulb mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing FixedDryBulb means the economizer will set the outdoor airflow rate at minimum if the outdoor air temperature is higher than a specified dry-bulb temperature limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing DifferentialDryBulb mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing DifferentialDryBulb will trigger the outdoor airflow to minimum when the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air is higher than the dry-bulb temperature of the return air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate in the Controller:OutdoorAir object?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate in the Controller:OutdoorAir object?
output: The entered value is used to define the Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate for the Controller:OutdoorAir object that will be generated by this template.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the Minimum Outdoor Air Control Type field?
output: Choices for this field are FixedMinimum or ProportionalMinimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the FixedMinimum option mean for the Minimum Outdoor Air Control Type?
output: FixedMinimum means that the minimum outdoor air flow rate is fixed no matter what the actual system flow rate is.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the ProportionalMinimum option mean for the Minimum Outdoor Air Control Type?
output: ProportionalMinimum means the minimum outdoor air flow rate varies in proportion to the total system air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Minimum Outdoor Air Control Type?
output: The default is ProportionalMinimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should you do if you want the minimum outdoor air to be the same for all hours in the entire year?
output: Leave the Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name field blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of specifying a schedule name in the Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name field?
output: If a schedule name is specified values are decimal fractions (0.0 -- 1.0) that multiply the minimum outdoor air flow rate. This schedule is useful for reducing the outdoor air flow rate to zero during unoccupied or start up hours.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the Economizer Type field?
output: The options for this field are FixedDryBulb DifferentialDryBulb FixedEnthalpy DifferentialEnthalpy ElectronicEnthalpy FixedDewPointAndDryBulb DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy and NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing NoEconomizer mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing NoEconomizer means the economizer will not operate and the outdoor airflow rate will be at the minimum for the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing FixedDryBulb mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing FixedDryBulb means the economizer will set the outdoor airflow rate at minimum if the outdoor air temperature is higher than a specified dry-bulb temperature limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing DifferentialDryBulb mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing DifferentialDryBulb will trigger the outdoor airflow to minimum when the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air is higher than the dry-bulb temperature of the return air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing FixedEnthalpy mean for the economizer operation?
output: FixedEnthalpy checks the upper limit of the enthalpy given as a field input against the enthalpy content of outdoor air and will set the outdoor airflow rate to minimum if the latter is greater than the former.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing DifferentialEnthalpy mean for the economizer operation?
output: DifferentialEnthalpy compares the return air enthalpy with the enthalpy of outdoor air. When the enthalpy of outdoor air is greater than the enthalpy of the return air the outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing ElectronicEnthalpy mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing ElectronicEnthalpy enables the simulation to calculate the humidity ratio limit of outdoor air based on the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air and a quadratic/cubic curve and compare it to the actual outdoor air humidity ratio. If the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated humidity ratio limit then the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing FixedDewPointAndDryBulb mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing FixedDewPointAndDryBulb compares both the outdoor dewpoint temperature and the outdoor dry-bulb temperature to their specified high limit values. If either outdoor temperature exceeds the high limit value the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy enables the control strategy to be based on both the DifferentialDryBulb and DifferentialEnthalpy economizer control strategies.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do all economizer control types check for?
output: In addition to all economizer control types listed above each control type checks for user-entered values for the upper limit of dry-bulb temperature enthalpy limit humidity ratio limit and dewpoint limit. The outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum if any of these entered limits are exceeded.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Economizer Type field?
output: The default for this field is NoEconomizer.

input: What is the only choice for the Economizer Lockout field?
output: The only choice for this field is NoLockout.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The default value is NoLockout.

input: What may future versions of the Economizer Lockout field include?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Economizer Upper Temperature Limit field?
output: Enter the outdoor air temperature high limit (°C) for economizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the enthalpy content of outdoor air is greater than the enthalpy given as a field input?
output: The outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum if the enthalpy content of outdoor air is greater than the enthalpy given as a field input.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the DifferentialEnthalpy control strategy do?
output: DifferentialEnthalpy compares the return air enthalpy with the enthalpy of outdoor air and sets the outdoor air flow rate to minimum if the outdoor air enthalpy is greater than the return air enthalpy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of the ElectronicEnthalpy control strategy?
output: ElectronicEnthalpy calculates the humidity ratio limit of outdoor air based on the dry-bulb temperature and a quadratic/cubic curve compares it to the actual outdoor air humidity ratio and sets the outdoor airflow rate to minimum if the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the outdoor dewpoint temperature or dry-bulb temperature exceeds their specified high limit values in the FixedDewPointAndDryBulb control strategy?
output: The outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum if either the outdoor dewpoint temperature or the outdoor dry-bulb temperature exceeds their specified high limit values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy control strategy enable?
output: DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy enables the control strategy to be based on both DifferentialDryBulb and DifferentialEnthalpy economizer control strategies.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is checked in addition to all economizer control types listed?
output: Each control type checks for user-entered values for the upper limit of dry-bulb temperature enthalpy limit humidity ratio limit and dewpoint limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the economizer control field?
output: The default for this field is NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
