instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a zero or no input in the field for outdoor air temperature low limit control mean?
output: It means that there is no outdoor air temperature low limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Economizer Upper Enthalpy Limit' field?
output: Enter the outdoor air upper enthalpy limit (in J/kg) for economizer operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air enthalpy is above the upper enthalpy limit for economizer operation?
output: The outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a zero or no input in the field for outdoor air enthalpy limit control mean?
output: It means that there is no outdoor air enthalpy limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the input for the 'Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature' field?
output: The input is the outdoor air dewpoint limit (ºC) for economizer operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air dewpoint temperature is above the maximum limit for economizer operation?
output: The outdoor airflow rate will be set to the minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the 'Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature' field required?
output: It is required if the Economizer Control Type 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' has been specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does no input in the 'Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature' field mean?
output: It means that there is no outdoor air dewpoint limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Supply Plenum Name' field if no supply plenum is to be modeled?
output: Set to blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be done if a supply plenum is modeled?
output: It must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the supply plenum serve?
output: It serves all zones on this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if any supply plenums have been specified?
output: The outlet from the system supply plenum will flow through the supply plenum to the zone terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Return Plenum Name' field if no return plenum is to be modeled?
output: Set to blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be done if a return plenum is modeled?
output: It must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the return plenum serve?
output: It serves all zones on this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if any zone return plenums have been specified?
output: The return air from the zone will flow through the zone return plenum and then into the system return plenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Supply Fan Placement' field?
output: Enter the supply fan placement type which can be either 'DrawThrough' or 'BlowThrough'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'DrawThrough' mean in the context of supply fan placement?
output: It models a system where the supply air fan is after the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'BlowThrough' mean in the context of supply fan placement?
output: It models a system where the supply air fan is before the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default supply fan placement type?
output: The default is 'DrawThrough'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be selected in the 'Supply Fan Part-Load Power Coefficients' field?
output: Select the set of generic pre-defined coefficients to use for the supply fan part-load power consumption.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the supply fan part-load power coefficients?
output: The choices are: InletVaneDampers OutletDampers VariableSpeedMotor ASHRAE90.1-2004Appendix G VariableSpeedMotorPressureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for the supply fan part-load power coefficients?
output: The default is 'InletVaneDampers'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/

input: What happens to the air flow through the supply plenum?
output: The air flows through the supply plenum to the zone terminal unit.

output: The field should be set to blank if no return plenum is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the return plenum serve?
output: This return plenum serves all zones on this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if zone return plenums have been specified?
output: The return air from the zone will flow through the zone return plenum and then into the system return plenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Supply Fan Placement' field?
output: Enter the supply fan placement type choosing between 'DrawThrough' or 'BlowThrough'.

input: What does 'BlowThrough' model in supply fan placement?
output: It models a system where the supply air fan is before the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where are the ASHRAE 90.1-2004 Appendix G coefficients from?

input: Where are the other sets of coefficients from?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'VariableSpeedMotorPressureReset' option based on?
output: It is based on Good Static Pressure Reset VSD Fan from Energy Design Resources: Design Guidelines: Advanced Variable Air Volume (VAV) Systems (EDR_DesignGuidelines_VAV.pdf).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Night Cycle Control' field?
output: Enter the system behavior during times when the System Availability Schedule is zero (off).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the possible inputs for 'Night Cycle Control'?
output: The possible inputs are 'StayOff' 'CycleOnAny' 'CycleOnControlZone' or 'CycleOnAnyZoneFansOnly'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'StayOff' mean in the context of Night Cycle Control?
output: It means the system will remain off no matter how hot or cold the zones may be.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'CycleOnAny' mean in the context of Night Cycle Control?
output: It means that if any zone served by this system has an air temperature outside the cooling or heating set points the central fan will turn on even though the System Availability Schedule indicates the fan is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'CycleOnControlZone' mean in the context of Night Cycle Control?
output: It means the same as 'CycleOnAny' except the availability manager looks at the temperature in only the zone specified in Night Cycle Control Zone Name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'CycleOnAnyZoneFansOnly' mean in the context of Night Cycle Control?
output: It is the same as 'CycleOnAny' except that only the zone fans are cycled on and the central air handler fan is left off (applicable only if using HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV:FanPowered in one or more zones).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for Night Cycle Control?
output: The default is 'StayOff'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Night Cycle Control Zone Name' field for the 'Cycle On Control Zone' option?
output: Enter the name of the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Heat Recovery Type' field?
output: Enter the type of air-to-air heat recovery available between the relief air stream and the outdoor air inlet stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for heat recovery type?
output: The choices are: None Sensible Enthalpy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default heat recovery type?
output: The default is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Sensible Heat Recovery Effectiveness' field?
output: Enter the sensible heat recovery effectiveness.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What is the figure related to VAV Supply Fan Part-Load Power Coefficient Options?
output: The figure related to VAV Supply Fan Part-Load Power Coefficient Options is located in the file 'image611.png'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the system behavior during times when the System Availability Schedule is zero?
output: Enter the system behavior during times when the System Availability Schedule is zero (off).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the possible inputs for Night Cycle Control?
output: The possible inputs are StayOff CycleOnAny CycleOnControl Zone or CycleOnAnyZoneFansOnly.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does StayOff mean in the context of Night Cycle Control?
output: StayOff means the system will remain off no matter how hot or cold the zones may be.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does CycleOnAny mean for Night Cycle Control?
output: CycleOnAny means that if any zone served by this system has an air temperature outside the cooling or heating set points the central fan will turn on even though the System Availability Schedule indicates the fan is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the difference between CycleOnControlZone and CycleOnAny in Night Cycle Control?
output: CycleOnControlZone means the same thing as CycleOnAny except the availability manager looks at the temperature in only the zone specified in Night Cycle Control Zone Name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of CycleOnAnyZoneFansOnly in Night Cycle Control?
output: CycleOnAnyZoneFansOnly is the same as CycleOnAny except that only the zone fans are cycled on and the central air handler fan is left off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for Night Cycle Control?
output: The default is StayOff.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Night Cycle Control Zone Name?
output: For the Night Cycle Control option Cycle On Control Zone enter the name of the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if other Night Cycle Control options are selected regarding the Night Cycle Control Zone Name?
output: For other Night Cycle Control options this field is ignored.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Heat Recovery Type?
output: Enter the type of air-to-air heat recovery which is available between the relief air stream and the outdoor air inlet stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for Heat Recovery Type?
output: The choices are: None Sensible Enthalpy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default Heat Recovery Type?
output: The default is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for Sensible Heat Recovery Effectiveness?
output: Enter the sensible heat recovery effectiveness. This is applied as a constant effectiveness at all conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range for Sensible Heat Recovery Effectiveness?
output: The valid range is from 0.0 to 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for Sensible Heat Recovery Effectiveness?
output: The default is 0.70.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for Latent Heat Recovery Effectiveness?
output: Enter the latent heat recovery effectiveness if Heat Recovery Type is Enthalpy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range for Latent Heat Recovery Effectiveness?
output: The valid range is from 0.0 to 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for Latent Heat Recovery Effectiveness?
output: The default is 0.65.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be selected for Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: Select the type of automatic reset control for the cooling supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: The choices are: None Warmest OutdoorAirTemperatureReset WarmestTemperatureFirst.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'None' option mean for Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: None means no reset use the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule or Cooling Coil Design Setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Warmest' option do for Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: Warmest resets the cooling supply air temperature to the highest supply air temperature that will meet the cooling requirements of all the zones at the maximum supply air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the minimum setpoint allowed for the 'Warmest' option in Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: The minimum setpoint allowed is the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the maximum setpoint allowed for the 'Warmest' option in Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: The maximum setpoint allowed is defaulted to the greater of 18C or the Heating Coil Design Setpoint plus 1.0C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'OutdoorAirTemperatureReset' option do for Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: OutdoorAirTemperatureReset resets the cooling supply air temperature based on the outdoor dry-bulb temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the setpoint when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below 15.6C for the 'OutdoorAirTemperatureReset' option?
output: The setpoint is the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint plus 5.2C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the setpoint when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or above 26.7C for the 'OutdoorAirTemperatureReset' option?
output: The setpoint is the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the setpoint varied for outdoor dry-bulb temperatures between 15.6C and 26.7C for the 'OutdoorAirTemperatureReset' option?
output: The setpoint is varied linearly.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'WarmestTemperatureFirst' option do for Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: WarmestTemperatureFirst finds the highest setpoint temperature that will satisfy all the zone cooling loads at minimum supply air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the setpoint temperature is less than the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint for the 'WarmestTemperatureFirst' option?
output: The setpoint temperature is set to the minimum and the supply air flow rate is increased to meet the loads.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the 'WarmestTemperatureFirst' option appropriate?
output: This option is appropriate when modeling a single-zone VAV system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range and default value for latent heat recovery effectiveness?
output: The valid range is from 0.0 to 1.0 and the default is 0.65.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered if Heat Recovery Type is 'Enthalpy'?
output: Enter the latent heat recovery effectiveness.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type field?
output: To select the type of automatic reset control for the cooling supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: None Warmest OutdoorAirTemperatureReset WarmestTemperatureFirst.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: The default is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Heating Coil Setpoint Reset Type field?
output: To select the type of automatic reset control for the central heating supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for Heating Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: None OutdoorAirTemperatureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for Heating Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: The default is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the dehumidification control type options?
output: None CoolReheat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the CoolReheat option do?
output: It cools beyond the dry-bulb setpoint to meet the humidity setpoint with reheat provided by terminal unit reheat coils if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default dehumidification control type?
output: The default is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Dehumidification Control Zone Name field specify?
output: It specifies the zone name where the humidistat is located for controlling dehumidification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Dehumidification Setpoint field specify?
output: It specifies the zone humidistat setpoint for dehumidification in percent (0 to 100).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default dehumidification setpoint?
output: The default is 60%.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the greater value used for the heating coil design setpoint?
output: The greater of 18C or the Heating Coil Design Setpoint plus 1.0C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the heating coil design setpoint?
output: The default is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Heating Coil Setpoint Reset Type' specify?
output: It specifies the type of automatic reset control for the central heating supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the Heating Coil Setpoint Reset Type?
output: The choices are None and OutdoorAirTemperatureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below -6.7C?
output: The setpoint is the Heating Coil Design Setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: It specifies the zone name where the humidistat is located for controlling dehumidification.

output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 mean for the Return Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1 mean for the Return Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the Return Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction be?
output: Must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default sizing method for the sum of the noncoincident zone design supply air flow rates?
output: The default is NonCoincident.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered if the system has a return fan?
output: Enter Yes if the system has a return fan. The default is No.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the total efficiency of the return fan?
output: The total efficiency of the return fan is the ratio of the power delivered to the air to the electrical input power at maximum flow. It is also the product of the fan motor efficiency and fan (impeller) efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is motor efficiency defined?
output: The motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is fan efficiency defined?
output: The fan efficiency is the power delivered to the air divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the total efficiency of the return fan be greater than and less than or equal to?
output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default pressure rise for the return fan?
output: The default is 500 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the return fan motor efficiency be greater than and less than or equal to?
output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 mean for the return fan motor in air stream fraction?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1 mean for the return fan motor in air stream fraction?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the return fan part-load power coefficients?
output: The choices are: InletVaneDampers OutletDampers VariableSpeedMotor ASHRAE90.1-2004Appendix G VariableSpeedMotorPressureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the VariableSpeedMotorPressureReset option based on?
output: The VariableSpeedMotorPressureReset option is based on Good Static Pressure Reset VSD Fan from Energy Design Resources: Design Guidelines: Advanced Variable Air Volume (VAV) Systems (EDR_DesignGuidelines_VAV.pdf).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> listing
input: What is an example of an IDF for a VAV system?
output: An example of an IDF for a VAV system is: HVACTemplate:System:VAV VAV Sys 1 !-Name FanAvailSched !- System Availability Schedule Name autosize !- Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate m3/s autosize !- Supply Fan Minimum Flow Rate m3/s 0.7 !- Supply Fan Total Efficiency 600 !- Supply Fan Delta Pressure Pa 0.9 !- Supply Fan Motor Efficiency 1 !- Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction ChilledWater !- Cooling Coil Type  !- Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name  !- Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name 12.8 !- Cooling Coil Design Setpoint C HotWater !- Heating Coil Type  !- Heating Coil Availability Schedule Name  !- Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name 10.0 !- Heating Coil Design Setpoint C 0.8 !- Gas Heating Coil Efficiency 0.0 !- Gas Heating Coil Parasitic Electric Load W None !- Preheat Coil Type  !- Preheat Coil Availability Schedule Name  !- Preheat Coil Setpoint Schedule Name  !- Preheat Coil Design Setpoint C 0.8 !- Gas

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The ASHRAE 90.1-2004 Appendix G coefficients are from TABLE G3.1.3.15 Method 2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> listing
input: What are the key parameters in the HVACTemplate:System:VAV example provided?
output: The key parameters include Name: VAV Sys 1 System Availability Schedule Name: FanAvailSched Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate: autosize Supply Fan Minimum Flow Rate: autosize Supply Fan Total Efficiency: 0.7 Supply Fan Delta Pressure: 600 Pa Supply Fan Motor Efficiency: 0.9 Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction: 1 Cooling Coil Type: ChilledWater Cooling Coil Design Setpoint: 12.8 C Heating Coil Type: HotWater Heating Coil Design Setpoint: 10.0 C Gas Heating Coil Efficiency: 0.8 Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate: autosize Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate: autosize Minimum Outdoor Air Control Type: FixedMinimum Economizer Type: DifferentialDryBulb Economizer Upper Temperature Limit: 19 C Economizer Lower Temperature Limit: 4 C Supply Fan Placement: DrawThrough Supply Fan Part-Load Power Coefficients: InletVaneDampers Night Cycle Control: CycleOnAnyZoneFansOnly Heat Recovery Type: None Sensible Heat Recovery Effectiveness: 0.70 Latent Heat Recovery Effectiveness: 0.65 Dehumidification Setpoint: 60.0 percent Humidifier Rated Capacity: 0.000001 m3/s Humidifier Rated Electric Power: 2690.0 W Humidifier Setpoint: 30.0 percent Sizing Option: NonCoincident Return Fan Total Efficiency: 0.7 Return Fan Delta Pressure: 500 Pa Return Fan Motor Efficiency: 0.9 Return Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction: 1.0 Return Fan Part-Load Power Coefficients: InletVaneDampers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the return fan motor in air stream fraction?
output: The return fan motor in air stream fraction is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the return fan part-load power coefficients?
output: The return fan part-load power coefficients are InletVaneDampers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object simulate?
output: This object simulates the system portion of a packaged direct-expansion based variable air volume HVAC configuration with several different heating options.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How are HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV objects related to HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV?
output: Multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV objects are usually specified for each HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is required for the Field: Name of the HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object?
output: A name must be entered for the HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object which is used in the HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV object to reference this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the System Availability Schedule Name field is left blank?
output: If left blank the system will be available for the entire year to perform heating or cooling if called for by the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified in the schedule if a System Availability Schedule Name is provided?
output: Times when the system is available should be specified as 1.0 and times when it is not available should have a zero value in the schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the schedule for the System Availability Schedule Name indicate for this system type?
output: For this system type the schedule indicates when the system is providing air flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate field?
output: Enter Autosize to set the system maximum air-flow rate to the sum of the zone air flow rates or enter a specific value as the upper limit on system flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a value is entered for the maximum air-flow rate?
output: The entered value becomes the upper limit on system flow even if the zone level air flow inputs sum to a greater value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Will the entered flow rate be multiplied by a sizing factor or zone multipliers?
output: No the flow rate will not be multiplied by a sizing factor or by zone multipliers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be ensured if using zone multipliers?
output: If using zone multipliers a value entered must be large enough to serve the multiplied zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate?
output: The units are m³/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Supply Fan Minimum Flow Rate field?
output: Enter the minimum supply air volume that may be provided which may be set to autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the Supply Fan Minimum Flow Rate?
output: The units are in m³/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object simulate?
output: This object simulates the system portion of a packaged direct-expansion based variable air volume HVAC configuration with several different heating options.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How are multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV objects related to the HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object?
output: Multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV objects are usually specified for each HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Field: Name of the HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object?
output: Enter a name for the HVACTemplate:System:PackagedVAV object. This name is used in the HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV object to reference this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if you want the system to be available for the entire year in the Field: System Availability Schedule Name?
output: Leave this field blank if you want the system to be available for the entire year to perform heating or cooling if called for by the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if a schedule name is provided in the Field: System Availability Schedule Name?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the system is available should be specified as 1.0. Those times that the system is not available should have a zero value in the schedule specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: System Availability Schedule Name schedule indicate for this system type?
output: For this system type this is a schedule of when the system is providing air flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate?
output: Enter Autosize to set the system maximum air-flow rate to the sum of the zone air flow rates. If a value is entered here for the maximum air-flow rate it is the upper limit on system flow even if the zone level air flow inputs sum to a greater value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Will the flow rate be multiplied by a sizing factor or by zone multipliers in the Field: Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate?
output: This flow rate will not be multiplied by a sizing factor or by zone multipliers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be ensured when using zone multipliers in the Field: Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate?
output: If using zone multipliers a value entered here must be large enough to serve the multiplied zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the Field: Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate?
output: The units are m³/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for the Field: Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Supply Fan Minimum Flow Rate?
output: Enter the minimum supply air volume that may be provided. This field may be set to autosize. The units are in m³/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the Field: Supply Fan Placement?
output: Enter the supply fan placement type. This alpha field has two choices DrawThrough or BlowThrough.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does DrawThrough model in the Field: Supply Fan Placement?
output: DrawThrough models a system where the supply air fan is after the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does BlowThrough model in the Field: Supply Fan Placement?
output: BlowThrough models a system where the supply air fan is before the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Field: Supply Fan Placement?
output: The default is DrawThrough.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Supply Fan Total Efficiency?
output: Enter the total efficiency of the supply fan. This value is the overall efficiency of the fan i.e. the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the product of motor efficiency and impeller efficiency in the Field: Supply Fan Total Efficiency?
output: It is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is motor efficiency defined in the Field: Supply Fan Total Efficiency?
output: The motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is impeller efficiency defined in the Field: Supply Fan Total Efficiency?
output: The impeller efficiency is power delivered to the fluid (air) divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated in the Field: Supply Fan Total Efficiency?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be the input value range for the Field: Supply Fan Total Efficiency?
output: This input value must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Field: Supply Fan Total Efficiency?
output: The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Supply Fan Delta Pressure?
output: Enter the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are considered standard conditions in the Field: Supply Fan Delta Pressure?
output: Standard conditions are considered 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Field: Supply Fan Delta Pressure?
output: The default is 1000 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Supply Fan Motor Efficiency?
output: Enter the shaft power of the supply fan divided by the electrical power consumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the Field: Supply Fan Motor Efficiency be greater than or equal to?
output: Must be greater or equal to the Supply Fan Total Efficiency and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Field: Supply Fan Motor Efficiency?
output: The default is 0.9.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction?
output: Enter the fraction of the motor heat that is added to the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 mean in the Field: Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1 mean in the Field: Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the input value range be for the Field: Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction?
output: Must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which object does the TwoSpeedDX coil type use?
output: TwoSpeedDX uses the Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoSpeed object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the preferred coil model for most applications?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which object does the TwoSpeedHumidControlDX option use?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is usually set for the cooling coil availability schedule name?
output: Usually set to blank which allows the cooling coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule name define for the cooling coil availability?
output: If a schedule name is specified it defines when the coil is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is a cooling coil availability schedule most often used?
output: This is most often used when cooling is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of one indicate for the cooling coil?
output: A schedule value of one indicates that the cooling coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of zero denote for the cooling coil?
output: A value of zero denotes that the cooling coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if a constant setpoint for the cooling coil is to be specified?
output: Leave this field blank and the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint value will be used at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if a set point schedule is to be used for the cooling coil?
output: Specify the schedule name here.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule control for the cooling coil setpoint?
output: The schedule should control the supply air temperature delivered to the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: For Blow Through fan placement what is the leaving air temperature?
output: For Blow Through fan placement this is the leaving air temperature from the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: For Draw Through fan placement what is the leaving air temperature?
output: For Draw Through fan placement this is the leaving air temperature after the supply fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: In what units are the values in the cooling coil setpoint schedule?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the cooling coil setpoint schedule name field ignored?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil design setpoint?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: TwoSpeedDX uses the Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoSpeed object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: TwoSpeedHumidControlDX uses the Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoStageWithHumidityControlMode object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: A schedule value of one indicates that the cooling coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: A schedule value of zero denotes that the cooling coil cannot be used during that time period.

input: What should the schedule control for the cooling coil?
output: The schedule should control the supply air temperature delivered to the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the leaving air temperature for Blow Through fan placement?
output: For Blow Through fan placement the leaving air temperature is from the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the leaving air temperature for Draw Through fan placement?
output: For Draw Through fan placement the leaving air temperature is after the supply fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: In what units are the values in the cooling coil schedule?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the assumed low-speed capacity for Cooling Coil Type = TwoSpeedDX?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7°C drybulb/19.4°C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35°C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Control Type' field?
output: Choices for this field are FixedMinimum or ProportionalMinimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does FixedMinimum mean for the Minimum Outdoor Air Control Type?
output: FixedMinimum means that the minimum outdoor air flow rate is fixed no matter what the actual system flow rate is.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does ProportionalMinimum mean for the Minimum Outdoor Air Control Type?
output: ProportionalMinimum means the minimum outdoor air flow rate varies in proportion to the total system air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: Choices for this field are FixedMinimum or ProportionalMinimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'FixedMinimum' mean in the context of minimum outdoor air control type?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should you do if you want the minimum outdoor air to be the same for all hours in the entire year?
