output: Enter the cooling supply air temperature in C to be used for sizing the cooling coil and zone supply air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Coil Design Setpoint used for?
output: Coil Design Setpoint is used as the supply air setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the OutdoorAirTemperatureReset option do?
output: OutdoorAirTemperatureReset varies the supply air setpoint based on the values entered for Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High and Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb High.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the Warmest option affect the cooling supply air temperature?
output: The Warmest option resets the cooling supply air temperature to the highest supply air temperature that will meet the cooling requirements of all the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the minimum setpoint allowed for the Warmest option?
output: The minimum setpoint allowed is the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the maximum setpoint allowed for the Warmest option?
output: The maximum setpoint allowed is defaulted to the greater of 18C or the Heating Coil Design Setpoint plus 1.0C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the ControlZone option do?
output: ControlZone controls the supply air temperature to meet the current cooling load for the zone specified as the Cooling Coil Control Zone Name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the user ensure regarding cooling coil and heating coil setpoints?
output: The user must ensure that the cooling coil and heating coil setpoints do not overlap to avoid unwanted simultaneous heating and cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the recommended difference between the cooling setpoint and the heating coil setpoint?
output: It is recommended that the cooling setpoint always be at least 0.1C higher than the heating coil setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered if the Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type is ControlZone?
output: Enter the name of the HVACTemplate:Zone:ConstantVolume object that contains the cooling thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default Cooling Coil Design Setpoint Temperature?
output: The default is 12.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if no Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule or Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type is specified?
output: The Cooling Coil Design Setpoint Temperature is used as a constant cooling supply air setpoint temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if a constant setpoint for the cooling coil is to be specified?
output: Leave the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field blank and the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint value will be used at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule control in the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field?
output: The schedule should control the supply air temperature delivered to the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low used for?
output: It is used when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below the low limit for outdoor air reset control with a default of 15.6C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low?
output: It is the low limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature for outdoor air reset control defaulting to 15.6C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High used for?
output: It is the cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or above the high limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling supply air setpoint temperature if no Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule or Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type is specified?
output: The default cooling supply air setpoint temperature is 12.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if a constant setpoint for the cooling coil is to be specified?
output: Leave the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field blank and the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint value will be used at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field?
output: The Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field is used to specify a schedule that controls the supply air temperature delivered to the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the leaving air temperature for Blow Through fan placement?
output: For Blow Through fan placement the leaving air temperature is from the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the leaving air temperature for Draw Through fan placement?
output: For Draw Through fan placement the leaving air temperature is after the supply fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type is not 'None'?
output: The Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field is ignored if the Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type is not 'None'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below the low limit?
output: The default cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature is 15.6C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low field?
output: The Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low field specifies the low limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature for outdoor air reset control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature for cooling coil setpoint control?
output: The default high limit is 23.3C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the Heating Coil Type field?
output: The choices for the Heating Coil Type field are HotWater Electric Gas and None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Heating Coil Type field?
output: The default value is HotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of the Heating Coil Availability Schedule Name field?
output: The Heating Coil Availability Schedule Name field defines when the heating coil is available often used when heating is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type used?
output: Used only when Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type = OutdoorAirTemperatureReset. The default is 12.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature in C for outdoor air reset control?
output: The high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature in C for outdoor air reset control. When the outdoor dry-bulb is at or above this temperature the setpoint is the value of Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High. Used only when Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type = OutdoorAirTemperatureReset. The default is 23.3C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the heating coil located in the supply air stream?
output: The heating coil is located in the supply air stream upstream of the cooling coil and after the outdoor air mixing box.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if no central heating coil is used in the Constant Volume system?
output: If no central heating coil is used in the Constant Volume system then the option 'none' should be specified here.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Is it likely that both a heating coil and a preheat coil would be used at the same time?
output: It is unlikely that both a heating coil and a preheat coil would be used at the same time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the heating coil type?
output: The choices for this field are HotWater Electric Gas None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the heating coil type?
output: The default value is HotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the configuration of HVACTemplate:System:ConstantVolume assume?
output: The configuration of HVACTemplate:System:ConstantVolume assumes that there will be reheat coils or baseboard heating to provide heating control at the zone level.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be coordinated if a heating coil is specified?
output: If a heating coil is specified the heating and cooling coil setpoint controls and availability schedules must coordinate to prevent the coils from opposing each other.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is usually set to blank regarding the heating coil availability?
output: Usually set to blank which allows the heating coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a specified schedule name define for the heating coil?
output: If a schedule name is specified it defines when the coil is available. This is most often used when heating is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do schedule values denote for the heating coil?
output: The schedule values denote whether the heating coil can run during a given time period. A schedule value of one indicates that the heating coil can be on during a given time period. A value of zero denotes that the heating coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the heating coil setpoint control type?
output: Specifies the heating coil setpoint control type: FixedSetpoint Scheduled OutdoorAirTemperatureReset ControlZone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default heating coil setpoint control type?
output: The default is FixedSetpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the user ensure about the cooling coil and heating coil setpoints?
output: The user must ensure that the cooling coil and heating coil setpoints do not overlap to avoid unwanted simultaneous heating and cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is recommended regarding the cooling setpoint in relation to the heating coil setpoint?
output: It is recommended that the cooling setpoint always be at least 0.1C higher than the heating coil setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the field 'Heating Coil Control Zone Name'?
output: Enter the name of the HVACTemplate:Zone:ConstantVolume object that contains the heating thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How many zones can contain a thermostat that controls heating operation in a HVACTemplate:System:ConstantVolume system?
output: While multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:ConstantVolume objects can be part of a HVACTemplate:System:ConstantVolume system only one of the zones contains a thermostat that controls heating operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should this field contain for a single zone system?
output: For a single zone system this field should contain the name of that zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the paragraph state about the heating coil during a certain time period?
output: The paragraph states that the heating coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Heating Coil Setpoint Control Type' specify?
output: The 'Field: Heating Coil Setpoint Control Type' specifies the heating coil setpoint control type.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the heating coil setpoint control type?
output: The options for the heating coil setpoint control type are: FixedSetpoint Scheduled OutdoorAirTemperatureReset and ControlZone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the FixedSetpoint option use as the supply air setpoint?
output: The FixedSetpoint option uses the Heating Coil Design Setpoint as the supply air setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Scheduled option use to set the supply air setpoint?
output: The Scheduled option uses the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule to set the supply air setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the OutdoorAirTemperatureReset option vary the supply air setpoint?
output: The OutdoorAirTemperatureReset option varies the supply air setpoint based on values entered for Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High and Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb High.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the ControlZone option do?
output: The ControlZone option controls the supply air temperature to meet the current heating load for the zone specified as the Heating Coil Control Zone Name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the maximum setpoint for the ControlZone option?
output: The maximum setpoint for the ControlZone option is the Heating Coil Design Setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the minimum setpoint allowed for the ControlZone option?
output: The minimum setpoint allowed for the ControlZone option is defaulted to the lesser of the Heating Coil Design Setpoint minus 5.2C or the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint minus 1.0C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the reference for more information on the ControlZone option?
output: The reference for more information on the ControlZone option is SetpointManager:SingleZone:Heating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default heating coil setpoint control type?
output: The default heating coil setpoint control type is FixedSetpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the user ensure regarding the cooling coil and heating coil setpoints?
output: The user must ensure that the cooling coil and heating coil setpoints do not overlap to avoid unwanted simultaneous heating and cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is recommended regarding the cooling setpoint in relation to the heating coil setpoint?
output: It is recommended that the cooling setpoint always be at least 0.1C higher than the heating coil setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Heating Coil Control Zone Name' require?
output: The 'Field: Heating Coil Control Zone Name' requires the name of the HVACTemplate:Zone:ConstantVolume object that contains the heating thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Can multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:ConstantVolume objects be part of a HVACTemplate:System:ConstantVolume system?
output: Yes multiple HVACTemplate:Zone:ConstantVolume objects can be part of a HVACTemplate:System:ConstantVolume system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How many zones contain a thermostat that controls heating operation in a HVACTemplate:System:ConstantVolume system?
output: Only one of the zones contains a thermostat that controls heating operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the 'Field: Heating Coil Control Zone Name' contain for a single zone system?
output: For a single zone system the 'Field: Heating Coil Control Zone Name' should contain the name of that zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Heating Coil Design Setpoint' specify?
output: The 'Field: Heating Coil Design Setpoint' specifies the heating supply air temperature in C to be used for sizing the heating coil and zone supply air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Heating Coil Design Setpoint value used as a constant heating supply air setpoint temperature?
output: The Heating Coil Design Setpoint value is used as a constant heating supply air setpoint temperature if no Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule or Heating Coil Setpoint Reset Type is specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Heating Coil Design Setpoint?
output: The default value for the Heating Coil Design Setpoint is 10.0C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if a constant setpoint for the heating coil is to be specified?
output: If a constant setpoint for the heating coil is to be specified leave the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field blank and the Heating Coil Design Setpoint value will be used at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if a setpoint schedule is to be used for the heating coil?
output: If a setpoint schedule is to be used for the heating coil specify the schedule name in the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule control in the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field?
output: The schedule should control the supply air temperature delivered to the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the leaving air temperature for Blow Through fan placement?
output: For Blow Through fan placement the leaving air temperature is from the heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the leaving air temperature for Draw Through fan placement?
output: For Draw Through fan placement the leaving air temperature is after the supply fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: In what units are the values in the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule?
output: The values in the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule are in degrees C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field ignored?
output: The Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field is ignored if the Heating Coil Setpoint Reset Type is something other than None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low' specify?
output: The 'Field: Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low' specifies the heating coil supply air setpoint temperature in C when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below the low limit (Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the 'Field: Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low' used?
output: The 'Field: Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low' is used only when Heating Coil Setpoint Control Type = OutdoorAirTemperatureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low?
output: The default value for the Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low is 15.0C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low' specify?
output: The 'Field: Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low' specifies the low limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature in C for outdoor air reset control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the setpoint the value of Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low?
output: The setpoint is the value of Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low when the outdoor dry-bulb is at or below the low limit specified in Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the 'Field: Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low' used?
output: The 'Field: Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low' is used only when Heating Coil Setpoint Control Type = OutdoorAirTemperatureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low?
output: The default value for the Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low is 7.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Heating Coil Design Setpoint?
output: Enter the heating supply air temperature in C to be used for sizing the heating coil and zone supply air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if no Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule or Heating Coil Setpoint Reset Type is specified?
output: The Heating Coil Design Setpoint value is used as a constant heating supply air setpoint temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Heating Coil Design Setpoint?
output: The default is 10.0C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if a constant setpoint for the heating coil is to be specified?
output: Leave the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field blank and the Heating Coil Design Setpoint value will be used at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if a set point schedule is to be used for the heating coil?
output: Specify the schedule name in the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the schedule in the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field?
output: The schedule should control the supply air temperature delivered to the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the leaving air temperature for Blow Through fan placement?
output: It is the leaving air temperature from the heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the leaving air temperature for Draw Through fan placement?
output: It is the leaving air temperature after the supply fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens to the Heating Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field if the Heating Coil Setpoint Reset Type is not None?
output: This field is ignored.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the heating coil supply air setpoint temperature when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below the low limit?
output: It is the value specified in the Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for the Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low?
output: The default is 15.0C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the low limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature for outdoor air reset control?
output: It is specified in the Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low?
output: The default is 7.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the heating coil supply air setpoint temperature when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or above the high limit?
output: It is the value specified in the Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for the Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High?
output: The default is 12.2C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature for outdoor air reset control?
output: It is specified in the Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb High field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Heating Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb High?
output: The default is 12.2C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper heating coil capacity?
output: Enter 'autosize' in the Heating Coil Capacity field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does specifying a value in the Heating Coil Capacity field represent?
output: It represents the maximum amount of heat that the coil can deliver in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should gas burner efficiency be entered for the Gas Heating Coil Efficiency field?
output: Enter gas burner efficiency as a decimal not as a percent.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default gas burner efficiency for the Gas Heating Coil Efficiency field?
output: A burner that is 80% efficient would have an entry of 0.8 which is the default.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Gas Heating Coil Parasitic Electric Load?
output: Enter the parasitic electric load associated with the gas heating operation such as a combustion fan in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the preheat coil located?
output: The preheat coil is located in the outdoor air stream upstream of the outdoor air mixing box and tempers the outdoor air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if no preheat coil is used in the constant volume system?
output: Specify 'none' in the Preheat Coil Type field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Is it common to use both a heating coil and a preheat coil at the same time?
output: It is unlikely that both a heating coil and a preheat coil would be used at the same time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the heating coil supply air setpoint temperature when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or above the high limit?
output: The heating coil supply air setpoint temperature is 12.2°C when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or above the high limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the heating coil supply air setpoint temperature used?
output: It is used only when the Heating Coil Setpoint Control Type is set to OutdoorAirTemperatureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature for outdoor air reset control?
output: The high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature is 12.2°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or above the high limit?
output: The setpoint is the value of Heating Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for Heating Coil Capacity to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity?
output: Enter 'autosize' to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does specifying a value for Heating Coil Capacity represent?
output: It represents the maximum amount of heat that the coil can deliver in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should gas burner efficiency be entered?
output: Gas burner efficiency should be entered as a decimal not as a percent.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default entry for a gas burner that is 80% efficient?
output: The default entry would be 0.8.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Gas Heating Coil Parasitic Electric Load?
output: Enter the parasitic electric load associated with the gas heating operation such as a combustion fan in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where is the preheat coil located in the system?
output: The preheat coil is located in the outdoor air stream upstream of the outdoor air mixing box.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if no preheat coil is used in the constant volume system?
output: The option 'none' should be specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the preheat coil field?
output: The choices are HotWater Electric Gas or None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the preheat coil field?
output: The default value is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be coordinated if a preheat coil is specified?
output: The preheat and cooling coil setpoint controls and availability schedules must be coordinated to prevent the coils from opposing each other.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is usually set for the Preheat Coil Availability Schedule Name?
output: It is usually set to blank allowing the preheat coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 1.0 indicate for the preheat coil?
output: A schedule value of 1.0 indicates that the preheat coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Preheat Coil Design Setpoint?
output: Enter the preheat supply air temperature in °C to be used for sizing the preheat coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default preheat supply air setpoint temperature?
output: The default is 7.2°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a constant setpoint for the preheat coil is to be specified?
output: Leave the Preheat Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field blank and the Preheat Coil Design Setpoint value will be used at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered if a setpoint schedule is to be used for the preheat coil?
output: Specify the schedule name in the Preheat Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should gas burner efficiency be entered for the gas preheat coil?
output: Enter gas burner efficiency as a decimal not as a percent.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default entry for a gas preheat coil burner that is 80% efficient?
output: The default entry would be 0.8.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the preheat coil type?
output: The choices for this field are HotWater Electric Gas or None. The default value is None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be coordinated if a preheat coil is specified?
output: The preheat and cooling coil setpoint controls and availability schedules must coordinate to prevent the coils from opposing each other.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is usually set to blank in the Preheat Coil Availability Schedule Name field?
output: Usually set to blank which allows the preheat coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 1.0 indicate in the Preheat Coil Availability Schedule?
output: A schedule value of 1.0 indicates that the preheat coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Preheat Coil Design Setpoint?
output: Enter the preheat supply air temperature in C to be used for sizing the preheat coil. The default is 7.2C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if no Preheat Coil Setpoint Schedule is specified?
output: If no Preheat Coil Setpoint Schedule is specified the Preheat Coil Design Setpoint value is used as a constant preheat supply air setpoint temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if a constant setpoint for the preheat coil is to be specified?
output: Leave the Preheat Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field blank and the Preheat Coil Design Setpoint value will be used at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should the gas burner efficiency be entered for the Gas Preheat Coil Efficiency field?
output: Enter gas burner efficiency as a decimal not as a percent. A burner that is 80% efficient would have an entry of 0.8 here which is the default.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the Gas Preheat Coil Parasitic Electric Load?
output: The units are in W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'autosize' mean for the Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate field?
output: Autosize means that 100% of the full supply flow may be taken from outdoor air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name?
output: This schedule is useful for reducing the outdoor air flow rate to zero during unoccupied or start up hours.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the Economizer Type field?
output: The options for this field are FixedDryBulb DifferentialDryBulb FixedEnthalpy DifferentialEnthalpy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the parasitic electric load associated with the gas heating operation?
output: Enter the parasitic electric load associated with the gas heating operation such as a combustion fan. The units are in W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate' field?
output: Enter autosize or a value for the maximum amount of outdoor air flow into the unit when the economizer is operating. Autosize means that 100% of the full supply flow may be taken from outdoor air. If a value is entered it is used instead of the autosize value. The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the 'Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate' used in the template?
output: The entered value is used to define the Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate for the Controller:OutdoorAir object that will be generated by this template.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate' field?
output: Enter autosize or the value for the minimum amount of outdoor air that can enter the unit and be distributed to the zones. Usually this is set to autosize and the value is calculated by the outdoor air requirements of each zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a value is entered for the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate'?
output: If a value is entered it overrides the outdoor air specification from the zone level. The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate'?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate' used in the template?
output: The entered value is used to define the Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate for the Controller:OutdoorAir object that will be generated by this template.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should you do if you want the minimum outdoor air to be the same for all hours in the entire year?
output: Leave the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name' field blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How are values specified if a schedule name is used for the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name'?
output: Values are decimal fractions (0.0 -- 1.0) that multiply the minimum outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the schedule in the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name' field?
output: This schedule is useful for reducing the outdoor air flow rate to zero during unoccupied or start up hours.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options available for the 'Economizer Type' field?
output: The options for this field are FixedDryBulb DifferentialDryBulb FixedEnthalpy DifferentialEnthalpy ElectronicEnthalpy (i.e. humidity ratio curve strategy) FixedDewPointAndDryBulb DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'NoEconomizer' mean?
output: Choosing NoEconomizer means the economizer will not operate and the outdoor airflow rate will be at the minimum for the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'FixedDryBulb' mean?
output: Choosing FixedDryBulb means the economizer will set the outdoor airflow rate at minimum if the outdoor air temperature is higher than a specified dry-bulb temperature limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when 'DifferentialDryBulb' is chosen?
output: Choosing DifferentialDryBulb will trigger the outdoor airflow to minimum when the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air is higher than the dry-bulb temperature of the return air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of 'FixedEnthalpy'?
output: FixedEnthalpy checks the upper limit of the enthalpy given as a field input against the enthalpy content of outdoor air and will set the outdoor airflow rate to minimum if the latter is greater than the former.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'DifferentialEnthalpy' do?
output: DifferentialEnthalpy does the same thing but compares the return air enthalpy with the enthalpy of outdoor air. When the enthalpy of outdoor air is greater than the enthalpy of the return air the outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of 'ElectronicEnthalpy'?
output: Choosing ElectronicEnthalpy enables the simulation to calculate the humidity ratio limit of outdoor air based on the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air and a quadratic/cubic curve and compare it to the actual outdoor air humidity ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated humidity ratio limit in 'ElectronicEnthalpy'?
output: If the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated humidity ratio limit then the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' compare?
output: Choosing FixedDewPointAndDryBulb compares both the outdoor dewpoint temperature and the outdoor dry-bulb temperature to their specified high limit values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if either outdoor temperature exceeds the high limit value in 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb'?
output: If either outdoor temperature exceeds the high limit value the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy' enable?
output: Another option DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy enables the control strategy to be based on both the DifferentialDryBulb and DifferentialEnthalpy economizer control strategies.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'NoEconomizer' mean for the simulation?
output: Choosing 'NoEconomizer' means the economizer will not operate and the outdoor airflow rate will be at the minimum for the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'FixedDryBulb' mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing 'FixedDryBulb' means the economizer will set the outdoor airflow rate at minimum if the outdoor air temperature is higher than a specified dry-bulb temperature limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the effect of choosing 'DifferentialDryBulb' on outdoor airflow?
output: Choosing 'DifferentialDryBulb' will trigger the outdoor airflow to minimum when the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air is higher than the dry-bulb temperature of the return air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'FixedEnthalpy' check for in economizer control?
output: 'FixedEnthalpy' checks the upper limit of the enthalpy given as a field input against the enthalpy content of outdoor air and will set the outdoor airflow rate to minimum if the latter is greater than the former.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does 'DifferentialEnthalpy' affect outdoor airflow?
output: 'DifferentialEnthalpy' compares the return air enthalpy with the enthalpy of outdoor air. When the enthalpy of outdoor air is greater than the enthalpy of the return air the outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'ElectronicEnthalpy' enable in the simulation?
output: Choosing 'ElectronicEnthalpy' enables the simulation to calculate the humidity ratio limit of outdoor air based on the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air and a quadratic/cubic curve and compare it to the actual outdoor air humidity ratio. If the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated humidity ratio limit then the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What conditions are checked by 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' for economizer control?
output: 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' compares both the outdoor dewpoint temperature and the outdoor dry-bulb temperature to their specified high limit values. If either outdoor temperature exceeds the high limit value the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy' enable in economizer control?
output: 'DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy' enables the control strategy to be based on both the 'DifferentialDryBulb' and 'DifferentialEnthalpy' economizer control strategies.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What additional checks are performed by each economizer control type?
output: Each control type checks for user-entered values for the upper limit of dry-bulb temperature enthalpy limit humidity ratio limit and dewpoint limit. The outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum if any of these entered limits are exceeded.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default economizer control type?
output: The default for this field is 'NoEconomizer'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Economizer Upper Temperature Limit' field?
output: The 'Economizer Upper Temperature Limit' field is used to enter the outdoor air temperature high limit (°C) for economizer operation. If the outdoor air temperature is above this limit the outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if no input is provided for the 'Economizer Upper Temperature Limit' field?
output: No input or zero in this field means that there is no outdoor air temperature high limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of the 'Economizer Lower Temperature Limit' field?
output: The 'Economizer Lower Temperature Limit' field is used to enter the outdoor air temperature low limit (°C) for economizer operation. If the outdoor air temperature is below this limit the outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a zero or no input imply for the 'Economizer Lower Temperature Limit' field?
output: No input or zero in this field means that there is no outdoor air temperature low limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Economizer Upper Enthalpy Limit' field?
output: The 'Economizer Upper Enthalpy Limit' field is used to enter the outdoor air upper enthalpy limit (in J/kg) for economizer operation. If the outdoor air enthalpy is above this value the outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does no input or zero mean for the 'Economizer Upper Enthalpy Limit' field?
output: No input or zero in this field means that there is no outdoor air enthalpy limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is specified in the 'Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature' field?
output: The 'Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature' field is used to input the outdoor air dewpoint limit (ºC) for economizer operation. If the outdoor air dewpoint temperature is above this value the outdoor airflow rate will be set to the minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is required if the Economizer Control Type 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' is specified?
output: This field is required if the Economizer Control Type 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' has been specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a blank input mean for the 'Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature' field?
output: No input (blank) in this field means that there is no outdoor air dewpoint limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the user-entered values for temperature enthalpy humidity or dewpoint limits are exceeded?
output: The outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum if any of these entered limits are exceeded.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the economizer control?
output: The default for this field is NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Economizer Upper Temperature Limit field?
output: Enter the outdoor air temperature high limit (°C) for economizer operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air temperature is above the upper temperature limit?
output: The outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does no input or zero in the upper temperature limit field indicate?
output: It means that there is no outdoor air temperature high limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Economizer Lower Temperature Limit field?
output: Enter the outdoor air temperature low limit (°C) for economizer operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air temperature is below the lower temperature limit?
output: The outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does no input or zero in the lower temperature limit field indicate?
output: It means that there is no outdoor air temperature low limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Economizer Upper Enthalpy Limit field?
output: Enter the outdoor air upper enthalpy limit (in J/kg) for economizer operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air enthalpy is above the upper enthalpy limit?
output: The outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does no input or zero in the upper enthalpy limit field indicate?
output: It means that there is no outdoor air enthalpy limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be input for the Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature field?
output: Input for this field is the outdoor air dewpoint limit (ºC) for economizer operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air dewpoint temperature is above the maximum dewpoint limit?
output: The outdoor airflow rate will be set to the minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature field required?
output: This field is required if the Economizer Control Type `FixedDewPointAndDryBulb has been specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does no input in the maximum limit dewpoint temperature field indicate?
output: No input (blank) in this field means that there is no outdoor air dewpoint limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Supply Plenum Name field if no supply plenum is to be modeled?
output: Set to blank if no supply plenum is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be done if a supply plenum is modeled?
output: It must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered here.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the supply plenum serve?
output: This supply plenum serves all zones on this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if any supply plenums have been specified?
output: The outlet from the system supply plenum will flow through the supply plenum to the zone terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Return Plenum Name field if no return plenum is to be modeled?
output: Set to blank if no return plenum is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be done if a return plenum is modeled?
output: It must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered here.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the return plenum serve?
output: This return plenum serves all zones on this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if any zone return plenums have been specified?
output: The return air from the zone will flow through the zone return plenum and then into the system return plenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Night Cycle Control field?
output: Enter the system behavior during times when the System Availability Schedule is zero (off).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the possible inputs for the Night Cycle Control field?
output: The possible inputs are StayOff CycleOnAny CycleOnControlZone or CycleOnAnyZoneFansOnly.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the StayOff option mean in the Night Cycle Control field?
output: StayOff means the system will remain off no matter how hot or cold the zones may be.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the CycleOnAny option mean in the Night Cycle Control field?
output: CycleOnAny means that if any zone served by this system has an air temperature outside the cooling or heating set points the central fan will turn on even though the System Availability Schedule indicates the fan is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the CycleOnControlZone option mean in the Night Cycle Control field?
output: CycleOnControlZone means the same thing as CycleOnAny except the availability manager looks at the temperature in only the zone specified in Night Cycle Control Zone Name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the CycleOnAnyZoneFansOnly option mean in the Night Cycle Control field?
output: CycleOnAnyZoneFansOnly is the same as CycleOnAny except that only the zone fans are cycled on and the central air handler fan is left off (applicable only if using HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV:FanPowered in one or more zones).
